Advanced Vocabulary - Page 1

Advanced

Advanced Vocabulary - Page 1

Master these sophisticated vocabulary words used in academic, literary, and professional contexts. These words will add precision and eloquence to your English communication.

Navigation

This is page 1 of 12. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Abdicate

/ˈæbdɪkeɪt/

verb

To give up or renounce a throne, high office, dignity, or function.

"The king decided to abdicate in favor of his son."

Synonyms: relinquish, surrender, resign

Category: Authority

Aberrant

/æˈberənt/

adjective

Departing from an accepted standard; deviant.

"His aberrant behavior concerned his colleagues."

Synonyms: abnormal, deviant, atypical

Category: Behavior

Abstruse

/æbˈstrus/

adjective

Difficult to understand; obscure.

"The professor's lecture on quantum mechanics was quite abstruse."

Synonyms: obscure, esoteric, recondite

Category: Complexity

Acrimonious

/ˌækrɪˈmoʊniəs/

adjective

Angry and bitter; harsh or biting in sharpness.

"The divorce proceedings became increasingly acrimonious."

Synonyms: bitter, hostile, caustic

Category: Emotion

Adroit

/əˈdrɔɪt/

adjective

Clever or skillful in using the hands or mind.

"She was adroit at handling difficult negotiations."

Synonyms: skillful, dexterous, clever

Category: Skill

Aesthetic

/esˈθetɪk/

adjective, noun

Concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty.

"The building's aesthetic appeal attracted many visitors."

Synonyms: artistic, beautiful, tasteful

Category: Art

Affable

/ˈæfəbəl/

adjective

Friendly, good-natured, or easy to talk to.

"Despite his high position, he remained affable and approachable."

Synonyms: amiable, genial, cordial

Category: Personality

Alacrity

/əˈlækrɪti/

noun

Brisk and cheerful readiness.

"She accepted the challenge with alacrity."

Synonyms: eagerness, enthusiasm, promptness

Category: Attitude

Altruistic

/ˌæltruˈɪstɪk/

adjective

Showing a disinterested and selfless concern for the well-being of others.

"Her altruistic nature led her to volunteer at the shelter every weekend."

Synonyms: unselfish, charitable, philanthropic

Category: Character

Ameliorate

/əˈmiljəreɪt/

verb

To make something bad or unsatisfactory better.

"The new policies were designed to ameliorate working conditions."

Synonyms: improve, enhance, mitigate

Category: Improvement

Analogous

/əˈnæləɡəs/

adjective

Comparable in certain respects, typically in a way that makes clearer the nature of the things compared.

"The heart is analogous to a pump in the way it circulates blood."

Synonyms: similar, comparable, parallel

Category: Comparison

Anathema

/əˈnæθəmə/

noun

Something or someone that one vehemently dislikes.

"The idea of censorship was anathema to the journalist."

Synonyms: abomination, curse, bane

Category: Opposition
